poem:
"Immortalised Arc"

Barely perceived in the realm of the pixelated,
Croft, bound in her cornerstone of stereotype,
Unravels her relics; in the dew of the floppy disc.
Each leap a clunky riddle, each pause an echo,
Faint as the grating wheel of a trolley,
Screeching in the absence of the electronic whirl.
In the slow dance of these ancient mechanics,
Yields a tale, oft played, never quite tamed.
